pathway_story: Used project-based learning at Pacifica to build a strong CS foundation and continued into applied data science studies.
Arrived from a public middle school in Santa Monica, grew through Pacifica STEM coursework and leadership in athletics, then pursued engineering at USC.
Entered Pacifica from West LA, developed voice through PACARTS and student leadership, and continued creative studies at UCLA.
Moved from Inglewood to Pacifica, paired rigorous academics with service learning, and enrolled in a policy-focused college path.
Started in South LA schools, sharpened critical thinking in Pacifica humanities and debate, then advanced toward law and ethics studies.
Built coding fundamentals at Pacifica and joined project-based clubs, then entered a paid apprenticeship pathway in software.
Developed as a student-athlete through Pacifica coaching and counseling support, then advanced to collegiate athletics.
Centered on service and character formation at Pacifica, then launched into a mission-oriented fellowship after graduation.
Combined visual arts training with Pacifica college prep and entered a design-focused university path in New York.
